result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan Keith Wrightsell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to 20CM1654. Credit for 1 day time served.

miscConds.notes:
-Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
- Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.

-Complete a parenting class.
-Complete Batterers Intervention class.
TBD at Restitution hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Keith Wrightsell
